DataElement.preferredName: Biospecimen Analyte or Aliquot Extracted Concentration Milligram per Milliliter Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value that represents the concentration of an analyte or aliquot extracted from the sample or sample portion, measured in milligrams per milliliter.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Biospecimen Analyte Or Aliquot Extraction Concentration
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._The sample or material being subjected to analysis._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._Pertaining to a portion of the whole; any one of two or more samples of something, of the same volume or weight._The act of pulling out, including the process of obtaining something from a mixture or compound by chemical or physical or mechanical means._The quantity of a substance per unit volume or weight; a measure of the amount of substance present in a unit amount of mixture, particularly, the amount of solute dissolved in a solvent. The amounts can be expressed as moles, masses, volumes, or parts.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.
